--- title: Intro to Pyspark author: Scott Wied date: 11/03/2022 format: html: code-fold: false number-sections: true toc: true toc-location: left code-line-numbers: true execute: warning: false --- # Intro to Pyspark ::: {.cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd import numpy as np ``` ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} from pyspark.sql import SparkSession spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate() ``` ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pyspark.sql.types as T import pyspark.sql.functions as F ``` ::: ## Create a Pandas Dataframe ::: {.cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} pdf = pd.DataFrame({'x':[1,2,3], 'y':[5,6,7]}) pdf.to_csv('test.csv') pdf.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4} ```{=html}
x y
0 1 5
1 2 6
2 3 7
``` ::: ::: ## Test to make sure Spark is working ::: {.cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} spark.sql("select 1+1").show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` +-------+ |(1 + 1)| +-------+ | 2| +-------+ ``` ::: ::: ### ::: {.cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} 1+1 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=6} ``` 2 ``` ::: :::
